item.description:
PORTSMOUTH ? Two tall ships will dock at State Pier for three days in August, including the first handicapped-accessible tall ship to visit the Port City.

The visit will kick off with a boat parade at 10:45 a.m. on August 15. The two ships will be available for tours from 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m up until the evening of August 17. Admission will be $8 per person or $20 for families of three or more. A dockside reception will be held August 16 (tickets are $30).

The Friendship is a 171-foot-tall rigged sailing ship that is a reproduction of a 1797 Salem East Indiaman, which was used in trade with East India and transatlantic trade during the early years of the new American Republic. It is the largest wooden Coast Guard certified sailing vessel to be built in New England in more than a century. The Friendship is also handicaped-accessible and features a museum above and below deck.

Read more...

item.name: Tall ships to visit Portsmouth in August
